alert.note: Alert for La Crosse; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 1:18AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Minnesota and west-central Wisconsin through 200 AM CDT... At 118 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Trempealeau to Spring Grove. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Trempealeau and Dakota around 125 AM CDT. Brice Prairie around 130 AM CDT. Onalaska and Holmen around 135 AM CDT. New Albin and Brownsville around 140 AM CDT. Stoddard around 145 AM CDT. Coon Valley around 200 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include County Roads G And H, Brinkman Ridge, Irish Hill, North Side Of La Crosse, Camp Decorah, South Side Of La Crosse, Goose Island, Stevenstown, Ridgeway and Rockland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 256 and 276. Interstate 90 in Wisconsin between mile markers 1 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southeastern Minnesota...and west central Wisconsin.
